intro: Conocephalopsis, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are typically small, terrestrial orchids that thrive in rocky or calcareous soils. They are characterized by their compact growth habit and often have a single, erect stem with a few leaves. The flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive shape that resembles a cone or helmet, giving the genus its scientific name. Conocephalopsis species are found in various parts of the world, particularly in temperate and subtropical regions.
